items.label: City And County Of San Francisco.

canvases.label: City And County Of San Francisco.

metadata.label: Short Title
metadata.value: City And County Of San Francisco.

metadata.label: Note
metadata.value: First map of the city to be included in Langley's directory. Early map to show the western and southern parts of the peninsula, with the land grants, and full topography. Also shows the northern part of San Mateo County and a small part of Marin County. Three insets show the Farrallon Islands. Directory not present. Map is without color.

metadata.label: Full Title
metadata.value: City And County Of San Francisco. Compiled From Official Surveys And Sectionalized In Accordance With U.S. Surveys. Drawn By V. Wackenreuder, C.E. 1861. Published By Henry G. Langley For the San Francisco Directory. Entered ... 1861 By Henry G. Langley ... California. Britton & Co. Print. (with 3 inset maps of the Farrallon Islands).

metadata.label: Pub Title
metadata.value: City And County Of San Francisco. Compiled From Official Surveys And Sectionalized In Accordance With U.S. Surveys. Drawn By V. Wackenreuder, C.E. 1861. Published By Henry G. Langley For the San Francisco Directory. Entered ... 1861 By Henry G. Langley ... California. Britton & Co. Print. (with 3 inset maps of the Farrallon Islands).

items.label: Topographical Map Of The Yosemite Valley And Vicinity. Preliminary Edition.

canvases.label: Topographical Map Of The Yosemite Valley And Vicinity. Preliminary Edition.

metadata.label: Short Title
metadata.value: Topographical Map Of The Yosemite Valley And Vicinity. Preliminary Edition.

metadata.label: Note
metadata.value: Yosemite valley in hachures with light cream tint.

metadata.label: Full Title
metadata.value: Topographical Map Of The Yosemite Valley And Vicinity. Preliminary Edition. Part Of East Central California. Mountain Drawing by J.E. Weyss; Lettering by J. Franke. From Topographical Plat by Lt. Macomb, Nov. 30, 1883. Julius Bien & Co. Photo. lith. Expeditions Of 1878-79, Under the Command of Capt. Geo. M. Wheeler, Corps of Engineers, U.S. Army. U.S. Geographical Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian.

metadata.label: Pub Title
metadata.value: Topographical Atlas Projected To Illustrate United States Geographical Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian Of Longitude Prosecuted In Accordance With Acts Of Congress Under The Authority Of The Honorable The Secretary Of War, And The Direction Of Brig. Genl. A.A. Humphreys, Chief Of Engineers, U.S. Army. Embracing Results Of the Different Expeditions Under The Command Of 1st Lieut. Geo. M. Wheeler, Corps Of Engineers. Julius Bien, lith. (with) Geological Atlas Projected To Illustrate Geographical Explorations And Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian Of Longitude ... Julius Bien, lith. (1876-1881)

metadata.label: Pub Note
metadata.value: A collection of 135 Topographical, Land Classification, and Geological Atlas sheets. An almost complete collection of all the Wheeler survey maps originally owned by the Salt Lake Mining Institute. I have since added maps to make it nearly a complete set, following the listing in P1281 (which lists 179 sheets, many of which are duplicates of sheets with minor variations). Many of the sheets in the original Salt Lake Mining Institute set have the signature of Ovando Hollister, an important figure in western mining history.

metadata.value: Full Image Download in MrSID Format

metadata.value: GeoViewer for JP2 and SID files

metadata.label: Note
metadata.value: This the first edition of the first year of issue of Beck's famous map of the London Underground railways, the first such map to use an entirely schematic and largely non geographical design for the railway system. This map is considered to be a landmark of twentieth century information design. See our 8727.000 for the second edition later in 1933.

metadata.label: Full Title
metadata.value: Map of London's Underground Railways. Underground. A new design for an old map. We should welcome your comments. Please write to Publicity Manager, 55, Broadway, Westminster, S.W.1 Waterlow & Sons Limited, London, Dunstable & Watford. (750M - 1-33)

metadata.label: Pub Title
metadata.value: Map of London's Underground Railways. Underground. A new design for an old map. We should welcome your comments. Please write to Publicity Manager, 55, Broadway, Westminster, S.W.1 Waterlow & Sons Limited, London, Dunstable & Watford. (750M - 1-33)

items.label: Composite: Panorama from Pt. Sublime. I-III.

canvases.label: Composite: Panorama from Pt. Sublime. I-III.

metadata.label: Short Title
metadata.value: Composite: Panorama from Pt. Sublime. I-III.

metadata.label: Note
metadata.value: In full color. Composite of all sections using Atlas Sheets 15-17.

metadata.label: Full Title
metadata.value: (Composite) Panorama From Point Sublime. [Parts I-III.] W.H. Holmes. Atlas Sheets XV-XVII. Julius Bien & Co. lith. U.S. Geological Survey, Geology of the Grand Canon District.

metadata.label: Pub Title
metadata.value: Department Of The Interior, United States Geological Survey, J.W. Powell Director. Atlas To Accompany The Monograph On The Tertiary History Of The Grand Canon District By Capt. Clarence E. Dutton U.S.A. Washington 1882. Julius Bien & Co. Lith. New York.

metadata.label: Pub Note
metadata.value: With superb panoramas by W.H. Holmes and Thomas Moran. This is one of the finest publications of U.S. Geological Survey. Full printed color. Bound in dark brown cloth covered boards with "United States Geological Survey J.W. Powell Director. Atlas To Accompany The Tertiary History Of The Grand Canon District. Dutton" stamped in gilt.

metadata.label: Authors
metadata.value: Dutton, Clarence E. (Clarence Edward), 1841-1912; Holmes, William Henry, 1846-1933

items.label: Map of the underground railways of London

canvases.label: Map of the underground railways of London

metadata.label: Short Title
metadata.value: Map of the underground railways of London

metadata.label: Note
metadata.value: Diagram of subway system of London. Includes color coded reference and text. "British Empire exhibition stations" shown in red.

metadata.label: Full Title
metadata.value: Map of the underground railways of London. Mcdonald, Gill. Waterlow & Sons Limited, London, Dunstable & Waterford. (on verso) Underground : what to see and how to travel : map of the electric railways of London. Issued free. Waterlow & Sons Limited, London, Dunstable & Waterford. (1/11/23). Electric Railway House, Westminster, S.W. 1. (with) Key map shewing main line railway, connections with main line termini. (and) Theatre plan.

metadata.label: Pub Title
metadata.value: Underground : what to see and how to travel : map of the electric railways of London. Issued free. Waterlow & Sons Limited, London, Dunstable & Waterford. (1/11/23). Electric Railway House, Westminster, S.W. 1. (with) Key map shewing main line railway, connections with main line termini. (and) Theatre plan. (on verso) Map of the underground railways of London. Mcdonald, Gill. Waterlow & Sons Limited, London, Dunstable & Waterford.

metadata.label: Pub Note
metadata.value: Three maps, on sheet 37x40.5 both sides, folded to 15.5x7.5. Includes key map, and theater plan, directories, schedules, text, and tables. On lower left margin (1/11/23). On verso: Map of Underground railways of London.

items.label: 1882. Progress Map Of The U.S. Geographical Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian.

canvases.label: 1882. Progress Map Of The U.S. Geographical Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian.

metadata.label: Short Title
metadata.value: 1882. Progress Map Of The U.S. Geographical Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian.

metadata.label: Note
metadata.value: Index areas to atlas maps in gold, routes and astronomical stations in red. Areas published in green, areas to be issued in blue or gold, areas embraced by 40th Parallel Survey in blue stripe.

metadata.label: Full Title
metadata.value: 1882. Progress Map Of The U.S. Geographical Surveys West Of The 100th Meridian. To accompany the Annual report of 1st Lieut. M.M. Macomb 4th Artillery U.S. Army. In charge of office. West Of The One Hundredth Meridian. Seasons of 1869, 1871, 1872, 1873, 1874, 1875, 1876, 1877, 1878 & 1879. Captain Geo. M. Wheeler. Corps Of Engineers, U.S. Army in Charge. United States Geographical Surveys.

metadata.label: Pub Title
